column4: ubuntu screwed my X configuration. now, the 1280x1024 screen resolution isn't available any more. what should I do ?
can you change the resolution using "Monitor"??? or use the command line utility, use xrandr to see what capabilities your monitor can use currently
xrandr says the maximum resolution is 1024x768. but previously, I used 1280x1024
you might want to reconfigure X or you can manually configure your xorg so that you can use the resolution you want, I suggest you try reconfiguring X first
how ?
how what ?
reconfigure X

you need to put that in the form of a question LoL  no, seriously ask again all in one line, hopefully someone will know how to do it if not I can dig up some documentation, ive never done that in 11.04
how can I reconfigure X?
http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/ubuntu-linux-how-to-reconfigure-x-windows-system-xorg-server/
I did that countless times, and it didn't change anything
the command sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg doesn't ask me any question
did you use sudo ?
of course I did
you might have to log in using just text mode OR hit ctrl-alt-f1, log in and try it again
do you mean I should quit X ?
hit CTRL-ALT-F1  then log in
I did that and ran dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, but nothing happened
how did your resolution get borked ?
I didn't do anything. ubuntu did it all
something happened and your resolution got change, what happened??? ubuntu cant turn your computer on by itself
but I didn't do anything special. I just booted my computer as usual
update your computer and reboot to safe mode
why ?
